title: feat(platforms/winit): New winit adapter
body: The example under `accesskit_winit` replaces the winit example in `accesskit_windows`, and now has all of the same behavior as the original example in `accesskit_windows`.

title: refactor(platforms/windows)!: Refactor window subclassing to avoid lifetime issue
body: Replaced `WindowSubclass` with `SubclassingAdapter`, which takes ownership of the main adapter. There's no loss of functionality though, because `SubclassingAdapter::into_inner` uninstalls the subclass and returns ownership of the main adapter. This also slightly simplifies the main winit example, and will make the main winit adapter, which must encapsulate everything in a struct, possible.

title: refactor(platforms/windows)!: Simplify the adapter API by always boxi…
body: I decided that the old API was over-complicated, with no real performance benefit. I decided it was time to simplify it before implementing the winit adapter.

title: feat(platforms/windows): Win32 subclassing support
body: This is a prerequisite for integrating with any windowing abstraction that doesn't support custom Win32 message handlers.

title: fix(platforms/windows): Restore the optimization of the FragmentRoot …
body: This addresses a slight regression in #102. The implementation of `PlatformNode::FragmentRoot` can't be quite the same as it was before the upgrade of windows-rs, but the original spirtit of the optimization is back.

title: Migrate to 2021 edition
body:
Unless I missed something, updating the `Cargo.toml` files is all we need to transition to the latest edition.

I think we are better off doing it now while the codebase is still small.

title: refactor!: String indices are always in UTF-8 code units
body:
I decided that, given the current state of AccessKit and where most of the interest in this project is coming from, I should optimize for simplicity of Rust code. When AccessKit is eventually used in languages that use UTF-16, the conversion to UTF-8 code units can be done in those languages.

This PR also removes the `testdata` directory, since I haven't been keeping that in sync with the schema anyway.

title: refactor!: Drop unused tree IDs
body: The concept of tree IDs isn't actually serving any purpose so far. It's just something I copied from Chromium. The Windows platform adapter doesn't do anything with it, and neither will any of the other platform adapters I plan to implement in the foreseeable future. I don't plan to actually implement support for child trees anytime soon. So to reduce clutter, and hopefully encourage actual adoption of AccessKit by GUI toolkits, I'm dropping this.

title: feat(common): Conversion from `NonZeroU64` to `NodeId`
body:
We're not sure what size `NodeId` should ultimately be. We may even end up making it configurable through a cargo feature. But we always want to make it easy to convert a `NonZeroU64` to a `NodeId`.

Suggested by @raphlinus.

title: fix(common): Various documentation fixes and improvements
body: Re-merging #105 with the correct conventional commit message.

title: Revert "Various documentation fixes and improvements"
body:
Reverts AccessKit/accesskit#105

I messed up the conventional commit message again.

title: chore(platforms/windows)!: Migrate to windows-rs 0.37
body: I'll make sure I get the commit message right this time.

title: Revert "chore(platforms/windows)!: Migrate to windows-rs 0.37"
body: I have to revert and re-merge _again_, because I screwed up the conventional commit message again.Reverts AccessKit/accesskit#107

title: chore(platforms/windows)!: Migrate to windows-rs 0.37
body:
This re-merges #102.

@str4d For the record, my intention is not to steal credit for your contribution. I'm simply fixing my previous messed-up merge.

title: Revert "Migrate to windows-rs 0.37"
body:
Reverts AccessKit/accesskit#102

I screwed up the merge. I got the conventional commit message wrong, and I probably should have included the bit about renaming `Event to `QueuedEvent`. Going to revert and re-merge.

title: Print usage text to the terminal from the Windows example
body:
This reduces the time-to-onboard, by removing the need to read and
understand the example's Windows GUI logic before being able to
interact with the example.

title: fix(consumer, platforms/windows): Resolve new clippy warning
body: A Rust update introduced a new clippy warning, which this PR fixes.

title: Switch to NonZeroU128 for NodeIDs
body: This handles clients who use UUIDs for widget IDs.
